HELLO!

My name is Kiran Channe and I am a Biomedical Engineering student at Toronto Metropolitan University with a strong interest in the electrical and computer aspects of engineering. My current technical experience includes Python, JavaScript, HTML, C, C++, MATLAB, and AutoCAD, and I'm eager to expand my skill set. I enjoy working on projects that challenge me to apply and develop new skills, while prioritizing innovation. Feel free to explore the rest of my website to learn about some of the projects I've worked on!

Augmented Reality in the Operating Room [Ongoing]

This image was taken from Engineering.com as a placeholder. Image will be updated as the project progresses.

Currently developing an AR application that provides surgeons with real-time visual feedback of patient anatomy and surgical tools using ArUco marker detection. Responsibilities include creating a program that creates and detects markers, ensuring accurate 2D pixel coodinate conversion to 3D spatial coordinates to provide precise pose estimation and transformations. This provides experience in AR integratoin, computer vision, and real-time tracking. Implementation is done through Python with OpenCV.

  • Date: Ongoing. GitHub repository will be updated as project progresses.

Assignment Tracker

A web-based Assignment Tracker designed to help organize and manage coursework efficiently. The goal was to create a simple, straightforward tool to prioritize tasks and track their progress, with completed tasks organized in their own section for a clean and easy-to-read layout. Built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Ned2 Robot

Ned2 is a 6-axis robot designed for robustness and precision. I have completed multiple tasks such as pick-and-place operations, pneumatic actuation, workplace simulation, and precise end-effector trajectory planning. This experience allowed me to develop skills in robotic automation, forward and inverse kinematics, transformations, motion planning, and real-time control, All actions were implemented using Python. Check out my GitHub for more details!

  • Date: September 2025 - December 2025
View on GitHub

Electrocardiogram (ECG)-Based Stress Monitoring Using HRV Features [Ongoing]

An ongoing project that explores heart-rate variability (HRV) features extracted from ECG segments to classify psychological stress. Using a dataset of 50+ participants exposed to spider video clips, ECG signals are filtered, R-peaks are detected with the Pan-Tompkins algorithm, and time- and frequency-domain HRV features are computed. Features are standardized and analyzed using logistic regression with leave-one-subject-out cross-validation. This project provides experience in ECG signal processing, HRV feature extraction, and artifact removal. All implementation and analysis done in MATLAB.

  • Date: Ongoing. GitHub repository will be updated as project progresses.
View on GitHub

Electromyogram (EMG) Device to Measure Action Potential of Biceps Brachii

Developed an electromyogram (EMG) device to measure biceps brachii activity. The design included a signal processing circuit with differential and inverting amplifiers, high- and low-pass filters, and a full-wave rectifier to amplify and refine the EMG signal while minimizing noise. The EMG data was digitized and transmitted to an Arduino microcontroller for real-time analysis, using thresholding to automatically detect muscle contraction and relaxation. Gained experience in biomedical instrumentation, analog signal processing, microcontroller interfacing, and real-time signal analysis using LabView, Arduino IDE and Python.

  • Date: November 2024
View on GitHub

Temperature Sensor Interfacing and Real-Time Fan Control Using PIC24 Microcontroller

Developed a temperature-sensing control system by implementing a TMP36 analog thermometer with a PIC24 microcontroller. I integrated ADC routines for precise signal acquisition, configured UART for asynchronous serial communication, and programmed real-time fan control based on temperature thresholds. I gained experience in embedded system design, microcontroller programming, analog-to-digital conversion and sensor-driven automation.

  • Date: November 2024
View on GitHub
